title: Voting starts in Tunisian presidential election
text:
Electoral workers prepare a ballot box inside a polling station during presidential election in Tunis, Tunisia, September 15, 2019. REUTERS/Muhammad Hamed

TUNIS (Reuters) - Tunisians began casting votes in an unpredictable presidential election with no overwhelming front-runner on Sunday, with the young democracy’s economic ills dominating the agenda.

While foreign attention, especially in Arab countries, is focussed on the moderate Islamist Ennahda party, many Tunisians are watching the fate of media mogul Nabil Karoui, running from behind bars on suspicion of tax evasion, which he denies.
description: Tunisians began casting votes in an unpredictable presidential election with no overwhelming front-runner on Sunday, with the young democracy's economic ills dominating the agenda.
